Projects list

  • Quelle Quote

    Interact with a quote-hoarding chatbot. Users can add quotes to a quotelist, then request a random one via the quote-command. Chatbot responds with quotes when specific words are used (kind of like Slackbot-responses)

  • CMD Digital Playground

    This progressive web app allows non-tech-y textwriters, developers, students and other collaborators to contribute to an environment that contains (in-depth) information about Communication and Multimedia Design, reflects CMD's view on Digital Interactive Design and displays their other activities or initiatives such as Battery or Golden Dot Awards. Final assignment of the minor Web Development 2020.

    • Real-Time Web

      Playing with sockets. You choose a photo category and are then matched with another active user. Once matched, a set of photos from both your categories will be fetched from Unsplash. You then both vote for the best photo out of two, 4 rounds. The person that chose the category with the most voted for photos, wins!

      • html
      • css
      • scss
      • client-side
      • javascript
      • server-side
      • node.js
      • express
      • ejs
      • liquid
      • sockets.js
      • api
      • mongodb

    • Matcher

      'MapMatcher': a "dating site" that tries to connect people that want to go to the same destination. It will take in your preferences and criteria and match you with people whose criteria you match.

    • Pointer Project

      'Zorgcowboys' project for KRO-NCRV Pointer during Information Design 2020. Users can find their own healthcare institution or an institution of interest and can shop with the profit they made in a specific year. Users can buy silly things in the webshop like a private jet or an Aston Martin supercar.

    'Boilerplates'

    As I explored different technologies and along the way also taught students (in) a certain techstack, I've created a few template projects to base a new project on. Most of them are not boilerplates but more like example projects. They serve the purpose of demonstrating the used tech in a more meaningful environment, providing enough context for a (new) developer to understand how everything works together.

    • Express-MongoDB

      Example project of an express server that handles a user registration flow and stores user data in a MongoDB Database.

    • MongoDB

      Just a simple example repo for usage of MongoDB Atlas database.

    • Code Cookbook Template

      Template for project documentation and guideline to the best practices for building and deploying webapplications.

    • 11ty-CMS-boilerplate

      Boilerplate for linking a headless CMS with a statically generated site.
